sentence.Network_en: Six passengers can be berthed amidships.
sentence.Network_cn: 六位乘客可安置在船的中央部分.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 17th cent.: from a-(expressing position or direction) + midship,influenced by amid

entry.def: Amidships means halfway along the length of a ship.

example.tran: 渡船拦腰撞上了我们的船。

means.word_mean: 1. at or near or toward the center of a ship;

sentences.sentence: "in the late 19th century, engines were placed in front, amidships, and at the rear"

auth_sentence.content: She folded Down amidships, Up at either end- her black prow just re-surfacing as recounted by the eyewitness Thayer.
auth_sentence.res_content: She folded Down amidships, Up at either end- her black prow just re-surfacing as recounted by the eyewitness Thayer.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: She folded Down amidships, Up at either end- her black prow just re-surfacing as recounted by the eyewitness Thayer.

auth_sentence.content: The same thing happens later, in Haiti, when Bond steals one boat and smacks it amidships into another.
auth_sentence.res_content: The same thing happens later, in Haiti, when Bond steals one boat and smacks it amidships into another.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The same thing happens later, in Haiti, when Bond steals one boat and smacks it amidships into another.

auth_sentence.content: Two men brought the skiff to a halt amidships, smiled and waved, then stood at attention.
auth_sentence.res_content: Two men brought the skiff to a halt amidships, smiled and waved, then stood at attention.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Two men brought the skiff to a halt amidships, smiled and waved, then stood at attention.
